title: What is the shortest rifle barrel length that is legal? - Quora

response.answer_text: From a Federal standpoint it would be a combination of a barrel no less than 16 inches And an overall length (in firing condition) of 26 inches. Less than that is legal but only with a Federal Tax stamp which costs $200 and the permission of the government. That’s not really the roadblock that it sounds, qualifying for the tax stamp isn’t especially rigorous, it’s mostly a waiting game for the paperwork to go through.

In the USA exactly 16″ from the closed bolt face to the end of the barrel itself minus any (easily)removable barrel extensions. This is for a regular, unregulated(most states) rifle. In many states you can legally obtain/create a short barreled rifle by going through the proper steps and paying the federal government $200, the same process you'd use for a legal machine gun.
